alert.note: Alert for Custer; Northern Rosebud; Powder River; Southern Big Horn; Southern Rosebud (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 6:46PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm outflow winds will impact portions of southeastern Big Horn, Custer, Powder River, Rosebud and eastern Sheridan Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 641 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorm outflow winds along a line extending from near Hillside to 13 miles northwest of Miles City to 13 miles east of Ashland to 35 miles southeast of Lame Deer to 8 miles southeast of Sheridan. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Weather station. This outflow as been producing reports of wind gusts 45 to 55 mph over the last hour. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Miles City, Broadus, Volborg, Clearmont, Leiter, Banner, Locate, Angela, Moorhead, Strawberry Hill Recreation Area, Matthews Recreation Area, Olive, Arvada, Otter, Twelve Mile Dam, Sonnette, Rock Springs, Garland, Moon Creek Ranch and Mizpah. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Wind gusts with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before seeking shelter. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for south central and southeastern Montana.

area.areaDesc: Custer; Northern Rosebud; Powder River; Southern Big Horn; Southern Rosebud
